name: grime
content:
grime noun [U]
(DIRT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a layer of dirt on skin or on a building: The walls were covered with grime. Wash off all the accumulated grime and dirt using water and detergent. Synonyms
dirt
filth
grunge (DIRT) informal
muck
smut (DIRT)
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
dirtdirtHis coat was covered with dirt.filthThe building was covered in filth.grimeI had to scrub to remove the grime from the bath.grungeI need to clean all the grunge off my earrings.gunkI have to clean all this gunk from the engine.gungeUK There's a load of gunge clogging the pipes.
See more results »
More examplesFewer examplesHe was always covered with dirt and grime.The cleanser will gently dissolve grime from the skin.A crew was trying to remove accumulated grime from the diving well.

grime noun [U]
(MUSIC)
a type of electronic music with a strong, fast beat and words spoken by an emcee (= a performer who speaks words over rap music): His son made him a grime playlist. I didn't expect a grime artist to do that.
More examplesFewer examplesToday, a lot more kids in London are sampling grime and hip hop.Grime star Dizzee Rascal led the way.At college she was drawn to the grime scene.
